function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Presence of environmental noise and exposure to dust and smoke on balconies.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Balconies are commonly used as spaces for food production and processing.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Balconies are important places for natural processing of food, which can pose health risks if not properly managed.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of balconies during the pandemic may lead to higher potential for contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased use of balconies as a result of the pandemic may lead to crowding and close contact between individuals, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation on small balconies may limit air circulation and increase the risk of airborne disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sufficient space on balconies may lead to a higher concentration of people in indoor communal areas, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased intensity of balcony use due to pandemic may lead to higher risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"People gathering on balconies increases the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate quarantine facilities and procedures during 19th-century ottoman empire","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate housing infrastructure for quarantine during covid-19 pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Questioning the use of the balcony in apartments during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 through viral contaminated surfaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temporary and potentially harmful nature of existing cleaning and disinfectant solutions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of nanotechnology for covid-19 mitigation","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Incremental rise in research on antimicrobial graphene compounds","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of graphene oxide go as an effective virucide","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of air filtration systems with graphene for virus killing","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of unproven technology for virus and bacteria elimination on masks and air filtration systems","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on carbon-based materials and composites for antiviral properties","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Requirement of laser treatment and sunlight exposure for reusable graphene-coated face masks","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of virucidal chemicals in disinfectant sprays due to their toxicity and adverse effects","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Corrosive nature and residue left by popular disinfectants sodium hypochlorite and hypochlorous acid","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Antibacterial and antiviral surface coatings at high-risk areas in hospitals, schools, and public places","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Breakthrough infections despite vaccine launch","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic impact of infectious diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of microbial infections, especially sars-cov-2, due to contaminated surfaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Longevity of sars-cov-2 on surfaces, leading to prolonged exposure risk.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited research on disinfection and killing mechanisms of sars-cov-2 on various surfaces.","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential spread of the virus through airborne aerosols and droplets on various surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Graphene oxide go and reduced graphene oxide rgo contain oxygen functional groups hydroxyl, carboxyl, carbonyl, and epoxy that affect their physicochemical properties.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Graphene derivatives with larger lateral size have stronger adsorption ability, which affects the physicochemical interaction with microorganisms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased number of graphene layers can weaken the antimicrobial activity and cause increased aggregation tendency.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Graphene derivatives with antimicrobial properties","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cytotoxicity of graphene derivatives due to negatively charged groups","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of promoting graphene derivatives as a primary solution for virus destruction","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sharp edges of graphene nano-walls inactivating bacteria and viruses, leading to potential reduction in survival rates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface modifications of graphene influencing antimicrobial activities and antiviral properties.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Agglomeration causing weakened dispersibility and adsorption capacity of graphene, reducing efficacy against microorganisms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper dispersion of nanomaterials like graphene and mnps may lead to reduced antimicrobial activity, allowing pathogens to spread","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overuse of surface disinfectant chemicals like sodium hypochlorite, hydrogen peroxide, or alcohol can have toxic effects and irritate occupants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of antimicrobial coatings with novel materials","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Debatable antimicrobial mechanism of graphene materials","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interaction between bacteria and gbns containing surfaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of unproven materials for antiviral applications","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability of biocidal activity of graphene-based materials","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited understanding of the long-term effectiveness of graphene-based surface coatings against sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of metal nanoparticles in high-performance coatings may pose a risk of environmental contamination and toxicity.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential risks associated with the use of graphene-based coatings for antiviral applications, including unknown long-term health effects and environmental impact.","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"}]}
